intro: Phoradendron microstachyum, commonly known as the lesser trumpetflower, is a woody climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found growing on trees in humid, forested environments.
